item.title: Build and Deploy a PCF Control Using Azure DevOps
item.description: In this post, I'll describe how you can use Azure DevOps build and release pipelines to build your PCF control from source control and deploy it to a Power Apps environment. I'll be building a single PCF control and only deploying to one environment, but this process can be expanded to handle multiple PCF controls and deploy across many environments.

item.title: Build a PCF Text Control
item.description: To get familiar with the various lifecycle methods involved in making a custom control using the Power Apps Component Framework, I'll make a simple text input control - similar but not as fully featured as the out-of-box text control in model driven Power Apps.

item.title: Boilerplate PCF Project Setup
item.description: In this post, I'll outline the steps to take to get a boilerplate Power Apps Component Framework project set up and running locally on your machine. I'll cover building and packaging of the PCF control into an importable CDS solution.
